text: [Music]
good morning from Marrakech Morocco
since I started travelling about five
years ago people have always told me to
go to Morocco what's so special about
this country why do people love it so
much I'm here to find out just that over
the next five days I'll be exploring all
over Morocco meeting as many people as I
can and diving deep into the closer
starting with the food because you can't
learn about a country without first
trying the food right it's one of the
most exciting parts about travel I've
never really had Moroccan cuisine before
today but I learned it's a mix of Arabic
and Mediterranean dishes with a twist of
European and sub-saharan flavors Street
food is everywhere with vendors cutting
meat in the open air and selling
colorful spices that give every street a
different aroma what is it some motive
are you hungry yet today I'm on a
mission to find the best Moroccan dish
along with my local friend's son
couscous small steamed balls of crushed
wheat grains usually served with
vegetables meat and chickpeas on top
this is called a Jean sort of like a
salad with Moroccan spiced vegetables
sitting on top of fresh cuts of lamb and
presented in a cone-shaped pot upside
down lemon on top so for lunch today we
have tangia and this is basically
slow-cooked beef in olive oil served in
a clay pot with lemon wedges onions
garlic cilantro and spices
wrap it in bread and heat this is
chicken buffalo a savory pie of chicken
cooked with saffron ginger pepper and
cinnamon layered in a crispy pastry with
almonds on top her drinks are all about
the fresh squeezed sweet orange juice
and hot Arabian tea also this orange
soda thing called Hawaii all these
dishes were incredible if I had to pick
one it would be the couscous I'm drew
pinsky and if you liked my travel videos
please click Subscribe and join me as I
plan to visit every country in the world
